result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent T. Zaccone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

No contact with the victim.  Not to go to her residence or any placed occupied by her.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete domestic abuse program.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Submit to evidentiary tests of blood, breath or urine at the request of DOC to monitor compliance.

Submit to counseling as ordered by the agent.

Restitution yet to be determined.

Costs, including DNA surcharge.

DNA sample to be provided.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from VTZ to Judge Sharp (9/19/17, clerk notes that Petition for Sentence Adjustment paperwork was received at some point by the Court but not filed with the Clerk at that time, however, Verification of Time Served was filed 11-4-16; per records check with DA's office, it appears Def was released to extended supervision 2/17/17; thus, any request for adjustment is no longer active)
Plea & Sentencing held this 7th Day of August 2015

Defendant Vincent T. Zaccone in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  This is a continuation of the plea/sentencing that started on June 23rd.  Def's plea has not yet been taken though the plea questionnaire was filed with the Court.  Def pleads to counts 1 and 5, no contest to both.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel and Def address the Court.

Sentence:  Count 1 - 5 year prison sentence with 2 years initial confinement and 3 years ext. supervision.  Count 5 - 1 year probation, consecutive to ext. supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision and probation:  No contact with victim.  Not to go to her residence or any place occupied by her.  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete d.a. program.  Not to possess/consume any alcohol.  Submit to evident. testing to monitor compliance.  Any counseling as ordered by agent.  Restitution to be determined at future hearing.  166 days credit.

Firearm and other felon admonishments given.  DNA sampling and surcharges ordered.  Program eligibility.  Remaining counts dismissed.

Re restitution - completed request due 9/8/15.  If restitution is disputed, hearing can be set.  No hearing set at this time.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-07-2015 02:30 pm
Joint request from DA and Atty McDougal to set this matter for plea & sentencing on August 7th. Also requested that jury trial scheduling remain on the calendar until that day.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing Before the Honorable William Andrew Sharp. June 23, 2015
(filed with the Court - verbal colloquy not conducted, however, as the hearing ended without entry of a plea change)
Status conference at 08-21-2015 02:00 pm

9:05 a.m.  Defendant Vincent T. Zaccone in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. McDougal informs the Court that the parties have reached a plea agreement - def will be pleading to count 1/strangulation and suffocation and count 5/misd. battery for imposed sentence of 18 months in and 18 months e.s. for count 1 and 9 months concurrent on count 5; conditions of e.s. to include no contact with victim, d.a. ed class, aoda/follow through, no alcohol, random u.a., and any other counseling as directed.  ADA notes that victim is also requesting restitution; that had not been stated as part of the negotiations.  Victim addresses the Court; states the amount of restitution is incomplete - presently at 17k between medical bills and damage to residence.  Atty. M requests separate hearing on restitution following State's submission of a motion/request on restitution.

Victim addresses the Court, providing exhibits. 

9:50 a.m.  Defense requests recess to confer out of presence of the Court.

Back on the record, Atty. M advises the Court that the def does not wish to proceed any further with plea/sentencing today; wants this matter to remain on the trial calendar.  Atty. M also requests motion hearing scheduling in the event that any are filed.

Court sets August 21 at 2 for final status/deadline for filing motions.

(Exhibits were never offered or received - Court has directed those exhibits held by the clerk.)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-23-2015 09:00 am

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Vincent T. Zaccone. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vincent T. Zaccone appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody.  Atty. M states that the parties are moving towards resolution; offer was finalized yesterday.  ADA states that the victim would like a few days adjournment to plea/sentencing.  Court sets June 23 at 9 for plea/sentencing.  Atty. M requests that the jury trial dates remain as scheduled for the time being.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Status conference at 04-15-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Vincent T. Zaccone in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA states the information hasn't been filed yet; states it will contain the same charges as the complaint; that document will be filed yet today.  Atty. McDougal states def will enter pleas of NG to all counts in that forthcoming document.  Court states charges.  Status requested in 3-4 weeks.  Court sets April 15 at 9.

Deputy Frawley asks the Court on the status of extradition; jail staff wants to know.  Court states that def will remain here until this matter is complete; extradition matter has not been filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's...
Arraignment at 03-19-2015 11:00 am

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Vincent T. Zaccone. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vincent T. Zaccone in court, in custody.  Counsel advise the Court that the def is waiving the prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver.  Waiver accepted.  Arraignment set for March 19th at 11.  Court notes receipt of letter from TT stating that def does not reside at her residence which is the address he's put on the bond.  Atty. M states def's current residence is the jail.  ADA Forehand states that, even if he posts cash bond, there's still the IL warrant, so address should reflect his present jail address.  Arraignment scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.
